meanings.definition: An enzyme that catalyzes the oxidation of luciferin, producing light.
meanings.sent1: Scientists use luciferase to study how light is created in fireflies.
meanings.sent2: The glow of fireflies is due to the action of luciferase.
meanings.sent3: When the luciferase enzyme gets to work, the firefly becomes a tiny lantern.
meanings.sent4: In the darkness of the night, luciferase transforms luciferin into a magical glow.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of a firefly's light is all thanks to luciferase.

meanings.definition: A protein that emits light when exposed to certain chemicals.
meanings.sent1: The researchers observed the glow of the protein luciferase in the lab.
meanings.sent2: When mixed with the right chemicals, luciferase can light up a room.
meanings.sent3: The party was dull until someone brought out the luciferase protein for a light show.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the room like luciferase in a dark cave.
meanings.sent5: The glow-in-the-dark toy contained luciferase for a fun surprise.

meanings.definition: A bioluminescent enzyme found in fireflies.
meanings.sent1: Children love to catch fireflies and watch the luciferase enzyme in action.
meanings.sent2: The magic of a firefly's glow comes from the luciferase within.
meanings.sent3: The firefly chuckled as it showed off its luciferase-powered light.
meanings.sent4: The forest sparkled with the tiny lights of luciferase-carrying fireflies.
meanings.sent5: The night sky was painted with the gentle glow of luciferase.
